00048 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_vert_collapse_edge_doc,
00049 ".. method:: vert_collapse_edge(vert, edge)\n"
00050 "\n"
00051 "   Collapse a vertex into an edge.\n"
00052 "\n"
00053 "   :arg vert: The vert that will be collapsed.\n"
00054 "   :type vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00055 "   :arg edge: The edge to collapse into.\n"
00056 "   :type edge: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00057 "   :return: The resulting edge from the collapse operation.\n"
00058 "   :rtype: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00059 );
00060 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_vert_collapse_edge(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00061 {
00062     BPy_BMEdge *py_edge;
00063     BPy_BMVert *py_vert;
00064 
00065     BMesh *bm;
00066     BMEdge *e_new = NULL;
00067 
00068     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!:vert_collapse_edge",
00069                           &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert,
00070                           &BPy_BMEdge_Type, &py_edge))
00071     {
00072         return NULL;
00073     }
00074 
00075     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_edge);
00076     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert);
00077 
00078     /* this doubles for checking that the verts are in the same mesh */
00079     if (!(py_edge->e->v1 == py_vert->v ||
00080           py_edge->e->v2 == py_vert->v))
00081     {
00082         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00083                         "vert_collapse_edge(vert, edge): the vertex is not found in the edge");
00084         return NULL;
00085     }
00086 
00087     if (BM_vert_edge_count(py_vert->v) > 2) {
00088         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00089                         "vert_collapse_edge(vert, edge): vert has more then 2 connected edges");
00090         return NULL;
00091     }
00092 
00093     bm = py_edge->bm;
00094 
00095     e_new = BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, py_edge->e, py_vert->v, TRUE);
00096 
00097     if (e_new) {
00098         return BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(bm, e_new);
00099     }
00100     else {
00101         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00102                         "vert_collapse_edge(vert, edge): no new edge created, internal error");
00103         return NULL;
00104     }
00105 }

00108 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_vert_collapse_faces_doc,
00109 ".. method:: vert_collapse_faces(vert, edge, fac, join_faces)\n"
00110 "\n"
00111 "   Split an edge, return the newly created data.\n"
00112 "\n"
00113 "   :arg vert: The vert that will be collapsed.\n"
00114 "   :type vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00115 "   :arg edge: The edge to collapse into.\n"
00116 "   :type edge: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00117 "   :arg fac: The factor to use when merging customdata [0 - 1].\n"
00118 "   :type fac: float\n"
00119 "   :return: The resulting edge from the collapse operation.\n"
00120 "   :rtype: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00121 );
00122 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_vert_collapse_faces(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00123 {
00124     BPy_BMEdge *py_edge;
00125     BPy_BMVert *py_vert;
00126 
00127     float fac;
00128     int do_join_faces;
00129 
00130     BMesh *bm;
00131     BMEdge *e_new = NULL;
00132 
00133     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!fi:vert_collapse_faces",
00134                           &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert,
00135                           &BPy_BMEdge_Type, &py_edge,
00136                           &fac, &do_join_faces))
00137     {
00138         return NULL;
00139     }
00140 
00141     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_edge);
00142     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert);
00143 
00144     /* this doubles for checking that the verts are in the same mesh */
00145     if (!(py_edge->e->v1 == py_vert->v ||
00146           py_edge->e->v2 == py_vert->v))
00147     {
00148         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00149                         "vert_collapse_faces(vert, edge): the vertex is not found in the edge");
00150         return NULL;
00151     }
00152 
00153     if (BM_vert_edge_count(py_vert->v) > 2) {
00154         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00155                         "vert_collapse_faces(vert, edge): vert has more then 2 connected edges");
00156         return NULL;
00157     }
00158 
00159     bm = py_edge->bm;
00160 
00161     e_new = BM_vert_collapse_faces(bm, py_edge->e, py_vert->v, CLAMPIS(fac, 0.0f, 1.0f), do_join_faces, TRUE);
00162 
00163     if (e_new) {
00164         return BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(bm, e_new);
00165     }
00166     else {
00167         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00168                         "vert_collapse_edge(vert, edge): no new edge created, internal error");
00169         return NULL;
00170     }
00171 }

00178 "\n"
00179 "   :arg vert: The vert to be dissolved.\n"
00180 "   :type vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00181 "   :return: True when the vertex dissolve is successful.\n"
00182 "   :rtype: boolean\n"
00183 );
00184 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_vert_dissolve(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00185 {
00186     BPy_BMVert *py_vert;
00187 
00188     BMesh *bm;
00189 
00190     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!:vert_dissolve",
00191                           &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert))
00192     {
00193         return NULL;
00194     }
00195 
00196     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert);
00197 
00198     bm = py_vert->bm;
00199 
00200     return PyBool_FromLong((BM_vert_dissolve(bm, py_vert->v)));
00201 }

00203 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_vert_separate_doc,
00204 ".. method:: vert_separate(vert, edges)\n"
00205 "\n"
00206 "   Separate this vertex at every edge.\n"
00207 "\n"
00208 "   :arg vert: The vert to be separated.\n"
00209 "   :type vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00210 "   :arg edges: The edges to separated.\n"
00211 "   :type edges: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00212 "   :return: The newly separated verts (including the vertex passed).\n"
00213 "   :rtype: tuple of :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00214 );
00215 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_vert_separate(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00216 {
00217     BPy_BMVert *py_vert;
00218     PyObject *edge_seq;
00219 
00220     BMesh *bm;
00221     BMVert **elem;
00222     int elem_len;
00223 
00224     /* edges to split */
00225     BMEdge **edge_array;
00226     Py_ssize_t edge_array_len;
00227 
00228     PyObject *ret;
00229 
00230 
00231     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O:vert_separate",
00232                           &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert,
00233                           &edge_seq))
00234     {
00235         return NULL;
00236     }
00237 
00238     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert);
00239 
00240     bm = py_vert->bm;
00241 
00242     edge_array = BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(&bm, edge_seq, 0, PY_SSIZE_T_MAX,
00243                                            &edge_array_len, BM_EDGE,
00244                                            TRUE, TRUE, "vert_separate(...)");
00245 
00246     if (edge_array == NULL) {
00247         return NULL;
00248     }
00249 
00250     if (BM_vert_separate(bm, py_vert->v, &elem, &elem_len, edge_array, edge_array_len)) {
00251         /* return collected verts */
00252         ret = BPy_BMElem_Array_As_Tuple(bm, (BMHeader **)elem, elem_len);
00253         MEM_freeN(elem);
00254     }
00255     else {
00256         ret = PyTuple_New(0);
00257     }
00258 
00259     PyMem_FREE(edge_array);
00260 
00261     return ret;
00262 }

00265 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_edge_split_doc,
00266 ".. method:: edge_split(edge, vert, fac)\n"
00267 "\n"
00268 "   Split an edge, return the newly created data.\n"
00269 "\n"
00270 "   :arg edge: The edge to split.\n"
00271 "   :type edge: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00272 "   :arg vert: One of the verts on the edge, defines the split direction.\n"
00273 "   :type vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00274 "   :arg fac: The point on the edge where the new vert will be created [0 - 1].\n"
00275 "   :type fac: float\n"
00276 "   :return: The newly created (edge, vert) pair.\n"
00277 "   :rtype: tuple\n"
00278 );
00279 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_edge_split(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00280 {
00281     BPy_BMEdge *py_edge;
00282     BPy_BMVert *py_vert;
00283     float fac;
00284 
00285     BMesh *bm;
00286     BMVert *v_new = NULL;
00287     BMEdge *e_new = NULL;
00288 
00289     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!f:edge_split",
00290                           &BPy_BMEdge_Type, &py_edge,
00291                           &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert,
00292                           &fac))
00293     {
00294         return NULL;
00295     }
00296 
00297     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_edge);
00298     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert);
00299 
00300     /* this doubles for checking that the verts are in the same mesh */
00301     if (!(py_edge->e->v1 == py_vert->v ||
00302           py_edge->e->v2 == py_vert->v))
00303     {
00304         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00305                         "edge_split(edge, vert): the vertex is not found in the edge");
00306         return NULL;
00307     }
00308 
00309     bm = py_edge->bm;
00310 
00311     v_new = BM_edge_split(bm, py_edge->e, py_vert->v, &e_new, CLAMPIS(fac, 0.0f, 1.0f));
00312 
00313     if (v_new && e_new) {
00314         PyObject *ret = PyTuple_New(2);
00315         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(bm, e_new));
00316         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, BPy_BMVert_CreatePyObject(bm, v_new));
00317         return ret;
00318     }
00319     else {
00320         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00321                         "edge_split(edge, vert): couldn't split the edge, internal error");
00322         return NULL;
00323     }
00324 }

00327 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_edge_rotate_doc,
00328 ".. method:: edge_rotate(edge, ccw=False)\n"
00329 "\n"
00330 "   Rotate the edge and return the newly created edge.\n"
00331 "   If rotating the edge fails, None will be returned.\n"
00332 "\n"
00333 "   :arg edge: The edge to rotate.\n"
00334 "   :type edge: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00335 "   :arg ccw: When True the edge will be rotated counter clockwise.\n"
00336 "   :type ccw: boolean\n"
00337 "   :return: The newly rotated edge.\n"
00338 "   :rtype: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00339 );
00340 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_edge_rotate(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00341 {
00342     BPy_BMEdge *py_edge;
00343     int do_ccw = FALSE;
00344 
00345     BMesh *bm;
00346     BMEdge *e_new = NULL;
00347 
00348     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!|i:edge_rotate",
00349                           &BPy_BMEdge_Type, &py_edge,
00350                           &do_ccw))
00351     {
00352         return NULL;
00353     }
00354 
00355     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_edge);
00356 
00357     bm = py_edge->bm;
00358 
00359     e_new = BM_edge_rotate(bm, py_edge->e, do_ccw, 0); /* BMESH_TODO - expose to API */
00360 
00361     if (e_new) {
00362         return BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(bm, e_new);
00363     }
00364     else {
00365         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00366     }
00367 }

00370 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_face_split_doc,
00371 ".. method:: face_split(face, vert_a, vert_b, coords=(), use_exist=True, example=None)\n"
00372 "\n"
00373 "   Split an edge, return the newly created data.\n"
00374 "\n"
00375 "   :arg face: The face to cut.\n"
00376 "   :type face: :class:`bmesh.types.BMFace`\n"
00377 "   :arg vert_a: First vertex to cut in the face (face must contain the vert).\n"
00378 "   :type vert_a: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00379 "   :arg vert_b: Second vertex to cut in the face (face must contain the vert).\n"
00380 "   :type vert_b: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00381 "   :arg coords: Optional argument to define points inbetween *vert_a* and *vert_b*.\n"
00382 "   :type coords: sequence of float triplets\n"
00383 "   :arg use_exist: .Use an existing edge if it exists (Only used when *coords* argument is empty or omitted)\n"
00384 "   :type use_exist: boolean\n"
00385 "   :arg example: Newly created edge will copy settings from this one.\n"
00386 "   :type example: :class:`bmesh.types.BMEdge`\n"
00387 "   :return: The newly created face or None on failure.\n"
00388 "   :rtype: (:class:`bmesh.types.BMFace`, :class:`bmesh.types.BMLoop`) pair\n"
00389 );
00390 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_face_split(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00391 {
00392     static const char *kwlist[] = {"face", "vert_a", "vert_b",
00393                                    "coords", "use_exist", "example", NULL};
00394 
00395     BPy_BMFace *py_face;
00396     BPy_BMVert *py_vert_a;
00397     BPy_BMVert *py_vert_b;
00398 
00399     /* optional */
00400     PyObject *py_coords = NULL;
00401     int edge_exists = TRUE;
00402     BPy_BMEdge *py_edge_example = NULL;
00403 
00404     float *coords;
00405     int ncoords = 0;
00406 
00407     BMesh *bm;
00408     BMFace *f_new = NULL;
00409     BMLoop *l_new = NULL;
00410 
00411     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw, "O!O!O!|OiO!:face_split", (char **)kwlist,
00412                                      &BPy_BMFace_Type, &py_face,
00413                                      &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert_a,
00414                                      &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert_b,
00415                                      &py_coords,
00416                                      &edge_exists,
00417                                      &BPy_BMEdge_Type, &py_edge_example))
00418     {
00419         return NULL;
00420     }
00421 
00422     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_face);
00423     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert_a);
00424     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert_b);
00425 
00426     if (py_edge_example) {
00427         BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_edge_example);
00428     }
00429 
00430     /* this doubles for checking that the verts are in the same mesh */
00431     if (BM_vert_in_face(py_face->f, py_vert_a->v) == FALSE ||
00432         BM_vert_in_face(py_face->f, py_vert_b->v) == FALSE)
00433     {
00434         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00435                         "face_split(...): one of the verts passed is not found in the face");
00436         return NULL;
00437     }
00438 
00439     if (py_vert_a->v == py_vert_b->v) {
00440         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00441                         "face_split(...): vert arguments must differ");
00442         return NULL;
00443     }
00444 
00445     if (py_coords) {
00446         ncoords = mathutils_array_parse_alloc_v(&coords, 3, py_coords, "face_split(...): ");
00447         if (ncoords == -1) {
00448             return NULL;
00449         }
00450     }
00451 
00452     /* --- main function body --- */
00453     bm = py_face->bm;
00454 
00455     if (ncoords) {
00456         f_new = BM_face_split_n(bm, py_face->f,
00457                                 py_vert_a->v, py_vert_b->v,
00458                                 (float (*)[3])coords, ncoords,
00459                                 &l_new, py_edge_example ? py_edge_example->e : NULL);
00460     }
00461     else {
00462         f_new = BM_face_split(bm, py_face->f,
00463                               py_vert_a->v, py_vert_b->v,
00464                               &l_new, py_edge_example ? py_edge_example->e : NULL, edge_exists);
00465     }
00466 
00467     if (f_new && l_new) {
00468         PyObject *ret = PyTuple_New(2);
00469         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, BPy_BMFace_CreatePyObject(bm, f_new));
00470         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, BPy_BMLoop_CreatePyObject(bm, l_new));
00471         return ret;
00472     }
00473     else {
00474         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00475                         "face_split(...): couldn't split the face, internal error");
00476         return NULL;
00477     }
00478 }

00481 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_face_join_doc,
00482 ".. method:: face_join(faces, remove=True)\n"
00483 "\n"
00484 "   Joins a sequence of faces.\n"
00485 "\n"
00486 "   :arg faces: Sequence of faces.\n"
00487 "   :type faces: :class:`bmesh.types.BMFace`\n"
00488 "   :arg remove: Remove the edges and vertices between the faces.\n"
00489 "   :type remove: boolean\n"
00490 "   :return: The newly created face or None on failure.\n"
00491 "   :rtype: :class:`bmesh.types.BMFace`\n"
00492 );
00493 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_face_join(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00494 {
00495     BMesh *bm = NULL;
00496     PyObject *py_face_array;
00497     BMFace **face_array;
00498     Py_ssize_t face_seq_len = 0;
00499     BMFace *f_new;
00500     int do_remove = TRUE;
00501 
00502     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O|i:face_join", &py_face_array, &do_remove)) {
00503         return NULL;
00504     }
00505 
00506     face_array = BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(&bm, py_face_array, 2, PY_SSIZE_T_MAX,
00507                                            &face_seq_len, BM_FACE,
00508                                            TRUE, TRUE, "face_join(...)");
00509 
00510     if (face_array == NULL) {
00511         return NULL; /* error will be set */
00512     }
00513 
00514     /* Go ahead and join the face!
00515      * --------------------------- */
00516     f_new = BM_faces_join(bm, face_array, (int)face_seq_len, do_remove);
00517 
00518     PyMem_FREE(face_array);
00519 
00520     if (f_new) {
00521         return BPy_BMFace_CreatePyObject(bm, f_new);
00522     }
00523     else {
00524         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00525     }
00526 }

00528 
00529 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_face_vert_separate_doc,
00530 ".. method:: face_vert_separate(face, vert)\n"
00531 "\n"
00532 "   Rip a vertex in a face away and add a new vertex.\n"
00533 "\n"
00534 "   :arg face: The face to separate.\n"
00535 "   :type face: :class:`bmesh.types.BMFace`\n"
00536 "   :arg vert: A vertex in the face to separate.\n"
00537 "   :type vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00538 "   :return vert: The newly created vertex or None of failure.\n"
00539 "   :rtype vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00540 "\n"
00541 "   .. note::\n"
00542 "\n"
00543 "      This is the same as loop_separate, and has only been added for convenience.\n"
00544 );
00545 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_face_vert_separate(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00546 {
00547     BPy_BMFace *py_face;
00548     BPy_BMVert *py_vert;
00549 
00550     BMesh *bm;
00551     BMLoop *l;
00552     BMVert *v_new;
00553 
00554     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!:face_vert_separate",
00555                           &BPy_BMFace_Type, &py_face,
00556                           &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert))
00557     {
00558         return NULL;
00559     }
00560 
00561     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_face);
00562     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert);
00563 
00564     bm = py_face->bm;
00565 
00566     if (bm != py_vert->bm) {
00567         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00568                         "mesh elements are from different meshes");
00569         return NULL;
00570     }
00571 
00572     l = BM_face_vert_share_loop(py_face->f, py_vert->v);
00573 
00574     if (l == NULL) {
00575         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00576                         "vertex not found in face");
00577         return NULL;
00578     }
00579 
00580     v_new = BM_face_loop_separate(bm, l);
00581 
00582     if (v_new != l->v) {
00583         return BPy_BMVert_CreatePyObject(bm, v_new);
00584     }
00585     else {
00586         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00587     }
00588 }

00591 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_face_flip_doc,
00592 ".. method:: face_flip(faces)\n"
00593 "\n"
00594 "   Flip the faces direction.\n"
00595 "\n"
00596 "   :arg face: Face to flip.\n"
00597 "   :type face: :class:`bmesh.types.BMFace`\n"
00598 );
00599 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_face_flip(PyObject *UNUSED(self), BPy_BMFace *value)
00600 {
00601     if (!BPy_BMFace_Check(value)) {
00602         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00603                      "face_flip(face): BMFace expected, not '%.200s'",
00604                      Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
00605         return NULL;
00606     }
00607 
00608     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(value);
00609 
00610     BM_face_normal_flip(value->bm, value->f);
00611 
00612     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00613 }
00614 
00615 
00616 
00617 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_utils_loop_separate_doc,
00618 ".. method:: loop_separate(loop)\n"
00619 "\n"
00620 "   Rip a vertex in a face away and add a new vertex.\n"
00621 "\n"
00622 "   :arg loop: The to separate.\n"
00623 "   :type loop: :class:`bmesh.types.BMFace`\n"
00624 "   :return vert: The newly created vertex or None of failure.\n"
00625 "   :rtype vert: :class:`bmesh.types.BMVert`\n"
00626 );
00627 static PyObject *bpy_bm_utils_loop_separate(PyObject *UNUSED(self), BPy_BMLoop *value)
00628 {
00629     BMesh *bm;
00630     BMVert *v_new;
00631 
00632     if (!BPy_BMLoop_Check(value)) {
00633         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00634                      "loop_separate(loop): BMLoop expected, not '%.200s'",
00635                      Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
00636         return NULL;
00637     }
00638 
00639     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(value);
00640 
00641     bm = value->bm;
00642 
00643     v_new = BM_face_loop_separate(bm, value->l);
00644 
00645     if (v_new != value->l->v) {
00646         return BPy_BMVert_CreatePyObject(bm, v_new);
00647     }
00648     else {
00649         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00650     }
00651 }
